title: Isolate the Radical
text: Isolate the radical on one side of the equation. We can add 1 on both sides get $$\sqrt[3]{9x-1}=-4$$ which has radicals isolated on one side.

title: Raise Both Sides Of the Equation To The Power Of The Index
text: $${\sqrt[3]{9x-1}}^3={\left(-4\right)}^3$$ After cubing both sides, we get $$9x-1=-64$$.

title: Check For Remaining Radicals
text: Are there any more radicals? No. We can proceed to the next step.

title: Solve For Equation
text: What is the value of x for $$9x-1=-64$$?
